abstract: Paul D. Ryan likes to cite the economist Friedrich von Hayek as an influence, but Hayek supported national health care and questioned Ronald Reagan’s policies, an economist writes.
snippet: Paul D. Ryan likes to cite the economist Friedrich von Hayek as an influence, but Hayek supported national health care and questioned Ronald Reagan’s policies, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of “The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform – Why We Need It and What It Will Take.”

headline.main: Why Hayek Isn’t Paul Ryan’s Guru
